page.title: 20RESIDENT'S ASSOCIATION
page.content: The majority of this report has been compiled by committee members of the Resident's Association (CHN.W.HOCKING) This group was initially formed as the boatowners group which unsuccessfully apposed the construction of a gabion sea wall in 1970.Later evolution of this pressure group saw it apposing extensive and intensive private and holiday development while encouraging the provision of local amenity. Membership includes individuals from most of the other societies in the villages,so it is able to act as a rallying point in any crisis.Presently the Association is liasing with the planning authority in order to produce a rationale for the future development of the village centre in Downderrry. Should a new parish structure develop, the Association may have engineered its own demise. R.J.DANIEL (Hon.Sec.)
